intro: Rhynchoglossum obliquum, commonly known as the oblique rhynchoglossum, is a flowering plant native to certain regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its striking, showy flowers that typically bloom in shades of red or pink. Its leaves are alternate and often have a velvety texture. Rhynchoglossum obliquum is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forests or along stream banks.
